description.raw:
ign-common and gazebo use similar color console mechanisms, but the log files can be very large. A [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2253/reduce-jenkins-console-log-size-fix/diff#chg-gazebo/common/Console.cc) helped reduce it a bit, so let's port it to ign-common as well.

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/10c16cfc0035144e4b523716615fe8fe5162

Here's the raw console output from `UNIT_SubMesh_TEST` on ign-common3:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-ign-common3-bionic-amd64/5/consoleText

~~~
78: [ RUN      ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m300[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m195[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m176[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m238[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m207[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m263[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m250[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m287[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m275[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m432[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mNo vertices or indices[0m
78: [       OK ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh (0 ms)
~~~

and here it is with this branch:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/111/consoleText

~~~
78: [ RUN      ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:300] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:195] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:176] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:238] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:207] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:263] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:250] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:287] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:275] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:432] [0m[1;31mNo vertices or indices[0m
78: [       OK ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh (1 ms)
~~~

Every `<<` operator call to an `ignerr`, `ignwarn`, etc generates these color encoding characters, which get massively inflated when converted to html in the jenkins or pipeline logs. This is just some low-hanging fruit, not trying to fully optimize all the console log sizes.

ign-common and gazebo use similar color console mechanisms, but the log files can be very large. A gazebo pull request helped reduce it a bit, so let's port it to ign-common as well.

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/10c16cfc0035144e4b523716615fe8fe5162

Here's the raw console output from UNIT_SubMesh_TEST on ign-common3:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-ign-common3-bionic-amd64/5/consoleText

78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m263[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m

78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m275[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m432[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mNo vertices or indices[0m
78: [       OK ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh (0 ms)

and here it is with this branch:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/111/consoleText
78: [ RUN      ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:300] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:195] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m

Every << operator call to an ignerr, ignwarn, etc generates these color encoding characters, which get massively inflated when converted to html in the jenkins or pipeline logs. This is just some low-hanging fruit, not trying to fully optimize all the console log sizes.

title.raw: port gazebo console log size reduction to ignition (issue #47)
title.html: port gazebo console log size reduction to ignition (issue #47)

description:
ign-common and gazebo use similar color console mechanisms, but the log files can be very large. A [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2253/reduce-jenkins-console-log-size-fix/diff#chg-gazebo/common/Console.cc) helped reduce it a bit, so let's port it to ign-common as well.

Here's the raw console output from `UNIT_SubMesh_TEST` on ign-common3:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-ign-common3-bionic-amd64/5/consoleText

~~~

title: port gazebo console log size reduction to ignition (issue #47)

summary.raw:
ign-common and gazebo use similar color console mechanisms, but the log files can be very large. A [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2253/reduce-jenkins-console-log-size-fix/diff#chg-gazebo/common/Console.cc) helped reduce it a bit, so let's port it to ign-common as well.

78: [1;31m[Err] [SubMesh.cc:432] [0m[1;31mNo vertices or indices[0m
78: [       OK ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh (1 ms)

Every << operator call to an ignerr, ignwarn, etc generates these color encoding characters, which get massively inflated when converted to html in the jenkins or pipeline logs. This is just some low-hanging fruit, not trying to fully optimize all the console log sizes.
